channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Special counsel John Durham’s team says a lawyer for Hillary Clinton sought to involve the FBI in a partisan plot to undermine rival Donald Trump. The defense rejects the charge as nonsensical. https://t.co/qIARbqQ1fL

A 21-year-old Russian tank-unit officer pleaded guilty to firing several shots at an unarmed man, in Ukraine’s first war-crimes trial since Russia’s invasion. Moscow has denied targeting civilians. https://t.co/iEFqe3tvzb
There are signs Elon Musk may be getting cold feet a few weeks after he agreed to buy Twitter for $44 billion. Here are the Tesla CEO’s options should he try to exit the deal. https://t.co/NAdJNFUv3F

Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell says the central bank needs to see that inflation pressures are abating to determine how to calibrate its approach to setting interest rates #WSJFuture https://t.co/1Gn6pMV6uV https://t.co/jCgor4rBaf

The U.S. extended a limited license held by Chevron that allows the oil company to maintain its operations in Venezuela and negotiate future business in an attempt to encourage talks between Nicolás Maduro's government and the U.S.-backed opposition https://t.co/aPNgKR2AdA
When Russia invaded Ukraine, U.S. stock exchanges suspended trading in most Russian stocks listed in New York. They skipped these two. https://t.co/YN8eVmQT4o
A Russian soldier admitted to killing an unarmed civilian in the first war crimes trial since the invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/51yfSUSeWX

Finland and Sweden formally applied to join NATO, a move that signals a historic shift in European security. Both nations have been on a trajectory to increase their military spending. #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/JlpzDrRaAU https://t.co/czInoU3n7K
Flight data indicates someone in the cockpit intentionally crashed a China Eastern jet in March, killing 132 people, say people familiar with an early U.S. review https://t.co/po4qHa036u
The European Union’s executive agency has proposed for the first time offering up to $9.5 billion to help Ukraine pay its bills through the rest of 2022, matching U.S. plans https://t.co/euY84H32yz
Few thought Germany could untangle its "catastrophic" reliance on Russian energy. In months, it has slashed use of Russian gas from 55% to 35%. https://t.co/2dA3ZanJIu
Heard on the Street: Elon Musk’s new Twitter diligence is as questionable as the bots he wants to ban https://t.co/y1TAOgYO4Y
Apple has paused plans to bring employees back to the office three days a week—up from two—following complaints from some workers https://t.co/vUGfacPb8Z
J Balvin, who managed to break out as a global superstar with songs in Spanish, is now working to break the stigma of mental health issues to the Latin community https://t.co/bFs3P2ca5Z

Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal posted a series of tweets defending the company’s ability to fight spam accounts. Elon Musk responded with multiple tweets, including one that solely said: 💩 https://t.co/2c3GNxBabs
Finland and Sweden have applied for NATO membership, a move that, if approved, would fundamentally transform the security landscape of Northern Europe https://t.co/SAr8ZpN2dS
JPMorgan Chase shareholders objected to a roughly $50 million retention bonus for CEO Jamie Dimon and voted against the bank’s compensation plan https://t.co/55lxWvujaB
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/59QowtVVJ7 https://t.co/keGnTWH0xV
Netflix said it is cutting about 150 employees in a new round of layoffs as the streaming company grapples with slowing revenue growth and a shrinking subscriber base https://t.co/2DLShs0Vv4
A 200-foot-long wildlife overpass under construction in Los Angeles aims to help the long-term survival of mountain lions and other animals. https://t.co/sWKL0PhImo

Bo Hines has won the Republican nomination for U.S. House in North Carolina's 13th Congressional District, the AP projects. The former college football player was endorsed by Donald Trump. https://t.co/U8lmdLBuoJ
North Carolina Rep. Madison Cawthorn, a freshman incumbent whose time in office was beset by blunders, has conceded defeat to state Sen. Chuck Edwards in the GOP primary https://t.co/t6oswq6zxB
Few thought Germany could untangle its "catastrophic" reliance on Russian energy. In months, it has slashed use of Russian gas from 55% to 35%. https://t.co/y8MWQGyNGO
In a closely watched GOP primary, North Carolina Rep. Madison Cawthorn is trailing State Sen. Chuck Edwards with 99% of the vote counted https://t.co/h0JOizbp32
Pennsylvania State Sen. Doug Mastriano, a retired Army colonel endorsed by Donald Trump, has won the Republican primary for governor, the AP projects https://t.co/Mkf2YvEVXp

“White supremacy is a poison, and it’s been allowed to fester and grow right in front of our eyes," President Biden said after visiting the site of the Buffalo mass shooting Tuesday. https://t.co/DBGnYA9999

Twitter said it is "committed to completing the transaction on the agreed price and terms as promptly as practicable," amid Elon Musk's claim that Twitter's CEO has refused to prove that less than 5% of accounts are fake https://t.co/UBbWzoA3oI

Casino mogul Steve Wynn is being sued by the Justice Department for failing to register as a lobbyist for a foreign country, after seeking a diplomatic favor for China from the Trump administration https://t.co/GMz7JxAOUF

The FDA authorized a booster dose of Pfizer’s Covid-19 vaccine for children 5 to 11 years old. The decision permits a third dose of the shot at least five months after the second dose. https://t.co/muNlgm6Q9l
JPMorgan Chase shareholders objected to a roughly $50 million retention bonus for Chief Executive Jamie Dimon and voted against the bank’s compensation plan Tuesday https://t.co/hcoKo49tEE
Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell speaks with @NickTimiraos at the #WSJFuture of Everything Festival https://t.co/RRZfvFeocu

Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said the U.S. and Europe should seek to end their reliance on China and Russia for commodities, calling more broadly for Western countries and their allies to shift trading relations away from potential global rivals https://t.co/5DeNqdfJsS
From @WSJopinion: Elizabeth Warren’s ‘anti-gouging’ bill would make today’s shortages look quaint. If you like today’s baby formula mess, pass this bill. https://t.co/AHyps9cKIv
From @WSJopinion: Ukrainians are fighting for their lives and their nation, and for the free world. Let it not be as a proxy, but as a partner, writes @Kasparov63 https://t.co/DeW6MjBRPw
New York City officials are recommending residents wear masks in indoor public spaces amid climbing Covid-19 cases in an effort to curb the spread of the virus https://t.co/7kP1ES6jJn
Musician and entrepreneur @JBALVIN speaks with @Ellie_Austin_ at the #WSJFuture of Everything Festival https://t.co/x1LHfG2ep4
Flight data indicates someone in the cockpit intentionally crashed a China Eastern jet in March, killing 132 people, say people familiar with an early U.S. review https://t.co/WNzxTcX1YX
Licensed gun makers built 11.3 million firearms in the U.S. in 2020, a 187% increase over the number they made in 2000, according to a federal report https://t.co/K6h2bSPngb

Federal investigators said they found a more than 1,700-foot-long drug-smuggling tunnel—with a ventilation system, reinforced walls, electricity and a rail system—connecting San Diego to Tijuana, Mexico https://t.co/rw3TX0jXQr

Long lines formed at a McDonald’s restaurant in Moscow after the company announced it will leave Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. It ends more than three decades of business in Russia. #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/x2juYNEXry https://t.co/c6vqbugH16
When Russia invaded Ukraine, U.S. stock exchanges suspended trading in most Russian stocks listed in New York. They skipped these two. https://t.co/MYPeEBpaap
Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell will take WSJ questions on inflation and economic outlook at 2 p.m. ET today https://t.co/MYqHdqOcD1
Hospitals are canceling CT scans and other imaging procedures as China’s Covid-19 lockdowns have led to a shortage of a dye widely used in medical scans https://t.co/lG6mft4Y29

Nestlé said it would fly extra baby formula into the U.S. from Switzerland and the Netherlands as the Gerber owner looks to accelerate deliveries to alleviate a severe shortage across the U.S. https://t.co/wT0oOtU5S3
Ukrainian fighters in Mariupol laid down their weapons at the Azovstal steel plant, concluding months of bloody battle for the strategic southern port https://t.co/sQme0jy8Q3
A 200-foot-long wildlife overpass under construction in Los Angeles aims to help the long-term survival of mountain lions and other animals. https://t.co/a7hglr7ada
A soccer team called Hashtag United started out as a group of friends who played video soccer games and streamlined them online. Now the team is attracting fans in real life. https://t.co/P3bJpJjSeA
A soccer team called Hashtag United started out as a group of friends who played video soccer games and streamlined them online. Now the team is attracting fans in real life. https://t.co/MZxLUfW0ZS
Elon Musk said his $44 billion bid for Twitter can’t move forward until the company is clearer about how many of its accounts are fake https://t.co/mMoMZvLlj5
A Congressional panel is holding a public hearing Tuesday on unidentified flying objects for the first time in more than five decades https://t.co/NzYnRXVwaE
